channel.title: PATH Issues
channel.description: I changed the system PATH to match my JDK: "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_32\bin;", but then when I tried doing ipconfig in cmd, it said it wasn't recognized as an internal or external command blah blah blah, so i did a search and found that the PATH must be: "C:\Windows;C:\Windows\system32" for it to recognize ipconfig. Is there another way of editing the PATH to accomplish both tasks?

item.title: PATH Issues
item.dc:creator: @senorlemon senorlemon
item.description:
@senorlemon wrote:

I changed the system PATH to match my JDK: “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_32\bin;”, but then when I tried doing ipconfig in cmd, it said it wasn’t recognized as an internal or external command blah blah blah, so i did a search and found that the PATH must be: “C:\Windows;C:\Windows\system32” for it to recognize ipconfig. Is there another way of editing the PATH to accomplish both tasks?

Read full topic
